caption: Wow, their outdoor seating is AMAZING. The best outdoor seating I've been in. Such a cute interior, then the outdoor patio with cover has magical plants and lights. Forgot I was in the city for a while. Started out with personalized wine recommendations based on our preferences for something fruity, less dry. We received a prosecco *off menu* (yes!!!) Don't remember the name but it was perfect. The caccio pepe was great, but was pleasantly surprised by the pasta with creamy pesto and shrimp. Service was so great and inviting all throughout. We really appreciate the experience. Will be back again.
Home made pasta, Italian waiter. What more are you looking for?
(Translated by Google) A very cozy place. Very good attention, very rich food. Small portions.  (Original) Un lugar muy acogedor. La atención muy buena, la comida muy rica. Porciones pequeñas.
So worth it I took the time to rate and say this place is a gem. Must visit 👌
Amazing place, I love the Italian decorations, pretty cozy. The wine was pretty good too. I'm in love with the pasta, It is actually favorite Italian restaurant in NYC.
Adhered to social distancing. Brilliant Italian experience. Great wine selection. Awesome food.
Amazing food. Beautiful and cozy back patio. Can't wait to go back!

Terre remains one of the best local Italians in NYC. Yes, that's a huge statement. Go and try it! Their unique wine list is impressive, it can be overwhelming as not mainstream however their servers will let you taste their recommendations. It is hard to go past the Black Truffle Burrata & Prosciutto or the White Venison Ragu but also some great veggie options. Their Cheese and Charcuterie is also amazing! The space is quaint and rustic but the gem is the backyard, especially during these COVID times.
Great for natural wine and authentic Italian pasta. Precise “outdoor dining” on your reservation if you wish to dine out in the patio
I had a beautiful experience eating there and the staff is very friendly also the food is amazing and the appetizers are the best together with the natural Italian wine.

I come here once a month to try delicious wines paired with Italian food that is both simple in ingredients and extraordinary in flavor. I have always been satisfied here. I have learned new things about wine regions and had my mine blown by the food. I recommend to anyone who wants an authentic Italian experience. Beautiful setting and thoughtful service. Love it 😍

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Brooklyn. The noodles and ingredients are so so fresh. The wine list is extensive and you can try it by the glass. The owner is actively working on the floor so that tells you how hands on and how much care is put into the food and experience.

I really love this spot, which stands out as a great Italian restaurant in a neighborhood with Italian restaurant overload. The menu is small but every item is carefully chosen with high quality ingredients. The wines are really good too. It’s not cheap but comparable to Provini and Al dí la. We dined in their lovely backyard recently, and I did have to take off one star because there were too many tables too close together during Covid. Every table indoors was also occupied. The servers are all lovely and the food is such high quality but I’m disappointed they are not following Covid distancing protocols that well. Probably won’t go back to eat there till they fix the seating. Maybe it’s leas crowded on a weekday...
Loved everything!!!! Def want to go back soon!

Two stars for our server, great service, took over 10 minutes after being seated to get a menu, which I had to go to the front and ask for. Best thing on the menu was the meat/cheese board. The octopus was over cooked and over salted. The truffle pasta was bland in taste. The boar ragu with pasta had such a heavy cheese taste it wasn't enjoyable. Overall I wouldn't recommend coming here. Restaurant has potential but for the price and quality of the food, it's not worth it. Really wanted to love it but the meal was very meh. Way way better places in the area.
Came for the natural wine but the food was on a diff level as well. Out of body experience!

Best restaurant Ive been to in New York City thus far. Not only was the food sensational, but the owner, Danielle was the reason for such an amazing experience overall. He deserves to be recognized for such great hospitality and attention to detail. Also, the aesthetics and environment in their outside dining garden were very warm and welcoming. Without a doubt making this italian gem my regular spot.

Absolutely amazing Italian food with great wine and superb service! The staff are so kind and super happy to talk to you about the food and well...anything. Everyone in our group loved the place and everything they got. Outdoor seating is ample and not on the sidewalk, which is a huge plus.
Just had a wonderful meal.  Everything was perfect and the service impeccable.  They outdid themselves.
Had a great time! Can't wait to go back :)

Very nice Italian restaurant wich looked from outside as empty wine store. But not this first look and impression to fool you, they are open and as you walk through it you will get to not too big, but very cozy backyard. You will really get immerse into the atmosphere of the Italian village. The food was very good and their wine list pretty extensive, including two types of orange wine.
Great food and wine and amazing service! We will be back.
Well good place very interesting wine great host...but the food has long way to go...
Just had an amazing experience!  The staff was so friendly and accommodating.  The dinner was perfect. Give them a try!
Fresh real Italian food in park slope! The wine list is great and the service and atmosphere is even better. Treat yourself to ssome amazing food and drink on a special day or anyday

Excellent food and atmosphere. Really loved it! We appreciated the wine recommendations and the opportunity to try new things (like orange wine). As the restaurant is super cozy (tight), all three or four wait staff were constantly walking by us and asking how things were. I would have appreciated bit less attention and interruption. I'd recommend trying to get a table in the very back.

Ate dinner on Valentine's Day here. My partner and I tried three pastas and only one of the secondi, the octopus. She was excited for the cacio e pepe. The sauce was light and the pasta was perfectly cooked. I loved the veal pappardelle with rosemary. That was my favorite, but we both were overjoyed with the ferricelli with black truffle, which was as rich and flavorful as one would hope. The octopus, grilled perfectly, came on top of a delicious salad.
Service was good. The prosciutto was delicious and definitely a must have item on the menu. Pasta was made to perfection.
Food was good, but not typical of most Italian restaurants., Very limited menu, and not for everyone. Very small....cramped during busy hours.

I take my family to this lovely place  a lot! This is my favorite spot to to have a good dinner.  I go there at least once a month. The meals are excellent, the staff is professional and the charge is good. I enjoy eating in this spot for a tasty meal.

I love this place, a true gem. Rarely do you leave a restaruant time and time again feeling like you can’t wait to come back. Highly recommend this place to all foodies. Must try their orange wine selection!
The best Italian place in the area. Paulo is great as always.
Probably the best Italian restaurant in Brooklyn.
Amazing atmosphere, service and food. Incredible selection of wines and the best truffle I've had anywhere in Brooklyn.

(Translated by Google) Well done excellent local cured and with basic ingredients for an excellent result Heart and love Thanks marta  (Original) Bravi ottimo locale curato e con ingredienti base per una ottima riuscita Cuore e amore Grazie marta
Spectacular pasta. All fresh, made in house. And the wine, so many possibilities!
Amazing service and an even better menu.  Terre has an amazing story and atmosphere.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a unique and tasteful experience.
Nice cute spot

Absolutely fantastic in all aspects!  Excellent, fresh made pasta.  The wild boar ragú was delicious, as was the wine (of which they had a wide selection available by the glass).  Service was very friendly and space was very cozy with great character.

Cute, romantic, charming vibe. Super friendly staff. Food sounded great on the menu.  Sadly everything we ordered felt very underwhelming - we're vegetarian so had ordered a kids spaghetti with pesto, the endive salad and the ricotta pasta.  At this price point, my benchmark would be flour + water in SF. The food simply didn't look or taste as great as we expected or wanted it to.

Pasta was pretty phenomenal being some of the best in the area. The pasta is legitimately that good. We had the gnocchi (so tender), Ferricelli (excellent truffle flavor), Trofie al Pesto & and Shrimps and the Ragu. Tough to choose, but the Trofie was the best we thought. The artisinal meat 🥩 & cheese 🧀 appetizer selection was very tasty. The Jamón Iberico was superb! Their wine knowledge and pairing was also good.  UPDATE:  They've established their footing since their opening. The backyard is a good spot to eat as well. It's so nice to ute and well decorated. Their brunch is SO GOOD. Carbonara noodles have good texture and excellent flavor. You MUST try the thick French Toast that tastes as if it had been soaking in some excellent flavor leaving it so moist. LOVE. THIS. PLACE.

Best dinner in Brooklyn so far. Visited on a Saturday night and got to dine in the gorgeous terrace at the back. It was quite busy but service was very attentive: I recommend to let them suggest you the wine based on your order, they definitely know best, our wine was just perfect with our seafood and vegetable pastas. Definitely going back to taste some more! A must for those looking for an authentic Italian experience with super interesting natural wines.
Exceptional service, great ambience  and some of the best Italian food we’ve had in the city.
Authentic piemontese food, organic wines, knowledgeable staff.

Live in the neighborhood and eat at all of the local restaurants constantly with my other half. You name it: Le Mistral, Stone Park, Palo Santo, etc. Never ate at Terre and can't explain why but something told me I'd be disappointed - and I was. The food is good. Just good. Not amazing. The service is attentive. The atmosphere is tight and crowded. I hope there is never a fire in there. The prices are way too high for the area. What killed me was when I asked for some bread as we had none at our table - you know, as they do in Italian restaurants with olive oil and such? - We were told there was a $2 charge for this. What? On a $250 bill for two in Brooklyn!!? The millennial manager came over and said he'd take it off of our bill. How kind of him. I'll take my Italian-American Brooklyn wallet elsewhere in my neighborhood.
Athentic Italian food in small, charming digs.
Such a cute little garden in the back.  The food is yummy too.
I thought this local Italian restaurant was beautifully designed and had great food. Definitely a cute place for a cozy date and generous amount of food given! I loved the wine selection too.

A charming local spot for sure. Friendly and welcoming staff. Went there for a quick bite. The food was OK, we didn't love the apps much  and felt the quality of the meats weren't good. Everything had bread which was overwhelming. Felt like I ate more bread than anything. The Octopus was overcooked and hard to chew with little to no flavor. The Asparagus was overcooked in 1 pasta dish and was very soggy. We did enjoy some other pasta dishes though. The wine was pretty good too. Unexpectedly though, our bills was $400 for 3 people. We had no idea that was coming-which was disappointing because we felt we were taken advantage of. When the manager or owner willingly shows up to your table saying he is opening a bottle for tonight that we should try we just felt that... we should try it. We had no idea it was an outrageously expensive bottle that would bring our bill that high. The meal was certainly not worth $400 and we wish we weren't tricked into drinking wine we didn't ask for. We were just trying to catch a quick bite and have a glass of wine. So, if you do head here, make sure you know what you're drinking.
Amazing food and wine in a very cozy atmosphere
Neighborhood gem
Excellent pastas with natural ingredients. The Lobster gnocchi was light and delicate and flavorful.

Really nice people that truly care for the food that they serve.  Excellent wine list that is ordered by the glass.  If you like creamy, order the caccio y pepe.  The venison ragu is my favorite- just order the damn thing.  You won't regret it.
Lots of great natural wines and exceptional traditional Italian dishes. Their homemade bread is excellent.
Great Place. Daniele mix a stunnig natural wine list with the best italian homemade food. Service is easy and friendly. Recommended.

Charming neighborhood restaurant with a warm ambiance, excellent service by knowledgeable staff and wonderful, obviously very fresh, pasta. We had two of the specials: tagliatelle with mushrooms and pancetta, and the gnocchi with pear and peccorino. Recommend.

Really wanted to like this place for the natural wine and authentic ambiance. The pasta (we got cacio e pepe, pesto shrimp pasta, and tagliatelle) left some to be desired and didn’t come out warm. Our waitress also seemed surprisingly new to wine...
(Translated by Google) A very rich dessert 😋  (Original) Un postre muy rico 😋
Absolutely amazing place. The Owner Daniele is passionate about natural wine and it shows in the wine list. Food is delicious, service is relaxed and friendly. A really great neighborhood gem!
Attentive service. Nice atmosphere. Homely feel. Delicious food.
Tiny gem of a place.  Great food and wine.

I have to say that this is one of my husband and I favorite place in the neighborhood. A true gem. The service is wonderful, food AMAZING, and wine lovely. Highly recommend. Say hi to Daniel the owner he is wonderful and always helps us pick the best wine!
Been walking by this place forever, finally went in. Wow, pasta was *amazing*. Great service, amazing wine, love the setting. This place is a winner.
Most probably the best procciuto ham and burrata I had in a long time. Food is delicious.
Number one in natural wine, orange, organic and biodynamic wines. Amaizing wine list, friendly service and delicious food. A must visit!

Incredible service, dazzling atmosphere, amazing pasta. I do have to say that the the few wines I sampled taste like someone made them in their garage. And they were quite expensive. Will return and try different wines next time.

(Translated by Google) Very nice and cozy, well cared for and enlivened by excellent music. Italian cuisine is excellent both in the preparation and in the choice of ingredients, but above all authentic! Attentive, prepared and available to all the staff! You can also recommend a genuine wine among many and you will soon be conquered!  (Original) Locale molto carino e accogliente, ben curato e allietato da ottima musica. La cucina italiana è di ottimo livello sia nella preparazione che nella scelta degli ingredienti, ma soprattutto autentica! Attento, preparato e disponibile tutto lo staff! Fatevi inoltre consigliare un vino genuino tra i tanti e sarete presto conquistati!

(Translated by Google) Better than average Italian restaurants .. let alone in American soil. A dip in Italian flavors and the most genuine cuisine that chef Tassi has been able to present in a delightful setting to delight New Yorkers. Bravo Daniele and congratulations to all the staff.  (Original) Migliore della media dei ristoranti italiani .. figuriamoci in terra americana . Un tuffo nei sapori italiani e nella cucina più genuina che chef Tassi ha saputo presentare in un delizioso contesto per deliziare i palati  newyorkesi. Bravo Daniele e complimenti a tutto lo staff.

Amazing experience and staff, rare and unique wines with fresh and delicious  pastas. Everything I try here is amazing and the space is so beautiful I felt I was transported back to italy!! Perfect brunch spot with friends and place to celebrate
Excellent, excellent lobster tail on gnocchi.  & great ambience.
I love Terre! This place is super cozy and laid back, and the pasta dishes are superb. I came here with my parents (who were visiting from Italy) and we had a great night. I'll definitely be back!
Beautiful space, great service. Good natural wine and wine cocktails.

This is one of my favorite spots in Brooklyn. It is cozy and warm and even the music is top notch! The wait staff is super friendly and educated - happy to let you taste as much of their abundant supply of natural wine as you like. Food selection is unbelievable and brings me right back to Italy. Love love LOVE Terre! Will always come back for the food, the service, and the dazzling atmosphere.

Very delicious pastas (the gnocchi was incredible). The staff was friendly and accommodating and we loved sitting facing the kitchen and watching all the action. These dishes would be way more expensive in manhattan!
From the excellent service to the homemade biscotti (pictured below) every bit of this Italian dining experience was memorable and delicious. We’ve been back more than a few times!

This place is delicious & the servers make you feel like family. So accommodating & sweet. We discovered delicious natural wine that has become our family favorite on advise of our waitress. The pasta dishes are prepared according to authentic Italian recipes. We especially love the special with chanterelles & porcini mushrooms. And of course the ice cream is a wonderful finish to a great meal!
Amazing service! The food was incredible! People should totally check it out!

Cozy and relaxed atmosphere with old world Italian feel. Service is personable and attentive. Enjoyed the extensive natural wine selection all of which can be ordered by the glass or bottle. The food is delicious and have yet to be disappointed. All of the ingredients are of high quality. Will continue to come here. Thank you for a great evening.
Best Italian food in Brooklyn by far.  Service was great and Daniele walks you through the whole food and wine menu.  Can’t wait to go back!

I couldn’t feel more at home. The (argentine) waitress let us have 3 or 4 tastings, and explained each wine with enthusiasm. We ordered 4 pastas (for 3people) and the chef came out to see how we liked it. Everyone was kind, paused in their busy lives, cared. The food was delicious. The wine was unique. The afogato was perfection. (They do have a gelato business) The decor is verging on cliche, but it’s so so sweet and the food so good that I would have it no other way. It was a dream. My only recommendations: over order, and be patient - it’s the only way to live.
Easy to get to from train. Amazing food.
Very nice and comfortable place. the dishes are very nice, and the quality of the food is great. the service is perfect! I will come back!!!

I really really really wanted to love this place. Had been walking by it for weeks anticipating a date night with fresh pasta and amazing wine. When said date night finally happened, we were really disappointed. Pretty sure the waitstaff are teenagers, that took forever to take our order and bring drinks. Didn't get our wine till way after we were done with first course. Ordered the eggplant appetizer, which was barely cooked, hard, and inedible. Shisito pepper app was an interesting idea, but hard to eat and not very flavorful. Pasta took about another 45 to arrive, and honestly just tasted like a very very expensive mac & cheese. Had to go to another restaurant after to redeem the night.

A beautiful space behind the great Gelato stand. Nice indoor setting and a great backyard garden. Wonderful wine selection- ever had orange wine?- and very friendly and helpful wait staff. The cheese (truffle) and prosciutto appetizer was delicious. The eggplant lasagna was more like eggplant with a tomato sauce. I think the pasta dishes are meant to be paired with a second meat, by themselves they feel lacking. We had the special (porcini mushrooms and truffle) and the first listed pasta (with pork jowl), the sauces and flavor was a bit too gentle and muted.. The strip steak was a nice serving and medium rare in the center, but medium throughout the rest. Overall: Good for drinks and appetizers in a nice garden

Ha, I guess that's it. My favourite Italian spot in Brooklyn. Okay, it is pricey, but hey, no other complains. Ingredients and quality unprecedented, friendly young *Italian* staff, jazz music in the background, dim illumination and candle light, low key environment, make this cosy restaurant a perfect destination for a casual or romantic evening meal. Price suggestion: $100 / person / full-course dinner, wine excluded.

I met a friend of mine for dinner there a couple of weeks ago, and although the food was excellent we still left with a sour taste. The food itself was really good, and seemed to be very authentic. The wine list is also very interesting and the wine we chose, by the glass was also good. Two things that made the evening memorable for all the wrong reasons, the waitress was trying to upsell on the wine, but just constantly tried to get us to have the expensive Barolo. I understand an upsell, but this was not the way to do it. What really upset us both was the Chef, who very enthusiastically congratulated us on our wine choice promised to give us a taste of another wine from his region. He filled our glasses, and made it seem like he was treating us, but at the end of the evening those two glasses of wine were on the check and were $21 each.  We were not asked if we wanted to buy this glass, or told the price in advance, and to have an extra $42 to pay on the bill felt dishonest. Of course they may have made an extra few bucks from us that night, but have now lost 4 customers, (we will not come back with our wives). Go for the food, but be really careful when they start to offer you extra wine.

Incredible!!! Best Italian food I’ve ever had and I’ve had a lot of Italian food. My gosh. The ragu is next level. The olive oil sampler is stunning. The bucatini is intense. The tiramisu is the best. The wines are top notch. The cappuccinos are perfect. There are no words to accurately describe how good this place is. I never leave such glowing reviews unless they are deserved and boy is this one ever deserved. Wow. 10 stars.
What a wonderful place. Authentic Italian food & very nice attentive staff!
Amazing
